metadata.title: CVE-2020-10751 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernels SELinux LSM hook implementationbefore version 5.7, where it incorrectly assumed that an skb would onlycontain a single netlink message. The hook would incorrectly only validatethe first netlink message in the skb and allow or deny the rest of themessages within the skb with the granted permission without furtherprocessing.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10751` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-106-generic - 4.15.0-106.107
linux-image-4.15.0-106-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-106.107
linux-image-4.15.0-106-lowlatency - 4.15.0-106.107
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-106-generic - 4.15.0-106.107
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-106-lowlatency - 4.15.0-106.107
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-62-generic - 5.3.0-62.56~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-106.107').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-62.56~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1067.68').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1073.77').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
